title: Toastmasters VNRVJIET : The Ingress of Ingenuity
author: Anonymous
description:
Toastmasters is a non-profit organization that helps people improve their communication, leadership and public speaking skills. The members of a Toastmaster Club meet regularly in community classes where they practice their communication skills by giving speeches, participating in skill-building exercises and going through discussion topics led by trained volunteers.  Their Goal is to become more effective communicators, build their confidence in front of an audience and share ideas that are meaningful to their members. Members learn from other members and from staff in ways that are fun and practical. Toastmasters International offers an array of programs to help you learn the most about your personal communication style, develop your leadership skills, and improve your oral communication.It is a learning community of more than 16,672 clubs with 357,718 members that are located across the world. Each club consists of no more than 7 members who meet regularly to practice speaking and leadership skills in public speeches. The clubs are open to anyone interested in improving his or her communication, leadership, and public speaking abilities.


Toastmasters VNRVJIET is a new student club at VNR Vignana Jyothi Institute of Engineering & Technology in Hyderabad. This club is a part of Toastmasters International and provides a platform for students to improve their communication and leadership skills. The club was founded by a group of enthusiastic students who recognized the need for such a platform to enhance their skills and prepare for their future careers. The purpose of the club is to provide a platform for students to improve their communication and leadership skills by practicing impromptu speeches, participating in public speaking events, and receiving feedback from other members. Members also have opportunities to take on leadership roles such as organizing events and managing club activities.


Dr.Sudha Devi who is associated with Toastmasters VNRVJIET told TOV that “Engineers are in high demand, but not always for the skills needed to be successful. Joining Toastmasters will enhance your public speaking and communication skills, which are essential. Engaging with people across all levels of an organization, Toastmasters can help you grow professionally. 


Engineers face the challenge of meeting with project team members, clients, and stakeholders from a technical background. While Toastmasters may not be for all engineers, it is worthwhile for those who want to speak more confidently in meetings and presentations. You can also learn new communication skills that will help you throughout your professional life. As an engineer, you have the opportunity to work with clients and colleagues in different industries. Toastmasters allows you to develop your communication skills to help you present technical information, understand client needs and interests, make presentations that generate new business opportunities, and practice your ability to participate in group discussions.As an engineer, you will interact with a wide variety of people in your professional life. However, many people in engineering careers have difficulty speaking to groups and presenting technical information to others. As a Toastmaster, you can improve your communication skills by joining our club and building a network of fellow engineers who share your passion for improving personal communication skills through self-improvement activities.


Toastmasters enables you to reach your full potential as a leader, business and technical communicator, and team member. Toastmasters is the leader in world-class training for professional communication skills. Through members-only programs, conferences and workshops, you will be able to develop the leadership, communication and interpersonal skills that may be required of you down the road in your career or any other calling you choose. It provides you with the skills and confidence you need to succeed in leadership roles at work, including managing projects and teams. Toastmasters is a nonprofit organization dedicated to helping people develop the skills they need to be effective leaders, through training and mentoring. Their signature six-month program is a superior way to develop your communication, leadership and management skills.


Through Toastmasters clubs, you can meet and network with other professionals in your field. You can learn from each other and grow a larger network of potential employers. Additionally, there are opportunities to practice and receive feedback on your communication and leadership skills at Toastmasters meetings. Beyond networking opportunities, Toastmasters provides an environment where you can learn from other members, build camaraderie among peers, and listen intently when speaking on podiums during workshops.Toastmasters is a place where you can practice and perfect your presentation skills, develop and improve your communication, leadership and time management

t skills, and make new friends in your industry.


Aditi a student from HITAM told TOV that in meetings every member would be deliver a speech and attend table topic sessions where they would learn to give feedback through evaluation by team members.Each person is assigned with a mentor to guide them in this journey which will help them improve their interpersonal skills and also helps them conquer their stage fear making them a confident person as a whole.

She was the part of the executive council of the club serving as vice president public relations which enabled her to explore a creative side of her and made her a good leader 


Toastmasters VNRVJIET is the home of students that want to get more out of their engineering college experience. As a student you will find Toastmasters benefits in many areas such as networking, learning new skills and self-development. Our experienced instructors can help you develop your communication, leadership and public speaking skills through our unique program.As members of Toastmasters, we help students learn the skills needed to communicate their ideas effectively in professional settings. This helps them develop confidence in public speaking and improves their ability to articulate their ideas effectively.

title: The man behind the Foundation that bears us: Acharya Sabbineni Venkateshwara Rao, Ph.D.
author: Siddharth.J
description:
“The route from Jal Vayu Vihar to the site of college construction in Bachupally was 6 kilometres. When I visited the site for the first time it was 18 acres of barren lands with hills, rocks and uneven ground levels. There was an irrigation well on the west side of the land. Vallurupalli Rattaiah & Seethamma Vignana Jyothi Residential School blocks were constructed towards the east side. In those partially filled blocks was my first office as the Principal of Vallurupalli Nageswara Rao Vignana Jyothi Institute of Engineering & Technology” The start was in motion and this is how the tenure of founding principal of VNR VJIET began”. Lets see how it all came to be from the very beginning


Prof. Sabbineni Venkateswara Rao was born on 3rd of August 1936 and is a native of Nagayalanka situated 48 kms from Machilipatnam. Completing his Bachelors in Civil Engineering from Kakinada college of Engineering. “There were no immediate divisions as departments as all the freshman students of engineering had the same syllabus. It was termed as FE. Departments were assigned based on the marks in FE. Civil Engineering Course was the most sought after Electrical Engineering & Mechanical Engineering Courses. There was no Computer Science. Luckily I got admission into the Civil Engineering Department in my sophomore year”


He started his journey by pursuing Masters from IIT Kharagpur in Structural Engineering and later got his Doctorate in Philosophy from IIT Kanpur in Structural Engineering. He joined the Regional College of Engineering Warangal (RECW) in the year 1961 a mere 2 years after its establishment by none other than then Prime Minister Jawaharlal Nehuru under the collaboration of Union & Federal Goverments for education which happened in the year 1959. He joined as an Associate Professor and continued his journey in the college until retirement till which he held many positions and designations as Professor, Project Engineer, Head of Civil Engineering Department and then retiring as Dean Administration in the year 1994. During his stay in RECW, he worked as convener of EAMCET Examinations and Admissions in 1983 and 1990. 

After his ReFirement, Sri Vallurupalli Nageswara Rao was an exceptional philanthropist who had a strong desire to improve the quality of education in Hyderabad. In the late 1980s, he founded a trust in memory of his parents. On April 24, 1989, the Vallurupalli Rattaiah & Seethamma Charitable Trust was officially registered, and collaborated with a non-profit organisation called Vignana Jyothi Society to establish the VRS Vignana Jyothi Residential School in the year 1995. His mission and dedication to provide quality education led him to establish the most renowned institute of  Higher Education in Telugu states. 


In the early days Vignana Jyothi Office was located in Ameerpet and accommodation was provided in the guest rooms where I stayed for a few weeks and had to dine in the restaurant opposite to the office of vj society”.


“I still remember, Kalvakuntra Taraka Rama Rao used to drop his sister Kalvakuntla Kavita to the college. She was then pursuing her 1st year as a student of Computer Science Engineering”


“I feel very happy when I see my students attaining great heights. Mahender Reddy IPS, who was the former Director General of Police of Telangana State was my student of Civil Engineering at RECW”
imgDesc: Acharya Sabbineni Venkateshwara Rao, Ph.D. - VNRVJIET
